dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Solid waste refers to materials regulated by the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) and includes both hazardous and non-hazardous waste. Under RCRA, only materials that meet the definition of solid waste can be classified as hazardous wastes. In 2018, about 146.1 million tons of municipal solid waste (MSW) were landfilled in the United States, with food being the largest component at about 24 percent, followed by plastics at over 18 percent, and paper and paperboard at about 12 percent. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) defines solid waste as any material that is discarded and not subject to an exclusion or variance, which includes materials that are abandoned, recycled, or inherently waste-like. The EPA also provides information on best practices for waste management and has developed tools for identifying appropriate waste staging and storage.

固体废物是指受1976年《资源保护和回收法案》（RCRA）监管的材料，该法案为美国的危险和非危险废物管理计划创建了框架。固体废物包括危险废物和非危险废物，只有符合《加拿大废物管理条例》固体废物定义的材料才能被归类为危险废物。环境保护局（EPA）参与研究固体废物管理，特别是环境清理，并制定废物分级的最佳实践。2018年，约1.461亿吨城市固体废物被填埋，其中食品是最大的成分。RCRA第D子标题下的固体废物计划鼓励各州管理非危险工业固体废物和MSW，制定垃圾填埋标准，并禁止公开倾倒。
